result.execSummary:
The defendant Clarence Wilson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcahrge. Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  All monies due to be paid by 7/21/15.  Nonpayment penalty is conversion into a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any sentence.  If no sentence being served, defendant to serve the remaining balance of 6 months, less 87 days credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clarence Wilson Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 6  MONTHS  in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any sentence with credit for  87 days served.  If no sentence now being served, defendant to serve the remaining balance of 6 months, less 87 days credit.
- No fine
- Pay DNA surcharge
- Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.
All monies due to be paid by 07-21-2015.  Court orders penalty for Nonpayment of costs, fees, assessments and surcharges is conversion into a civil judgment.  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Clarence Wilson in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Clarence Wilson in custody.  Joshua Mathy, appearing for Jennifer Lynn Williams, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant sworn as to his statements.

As to Count 1:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 dismissed and read-in as to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Clarence Wilson not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defendant is in custody and going to be revoked from this other matter.  Defense request a plea/sentencing hearing.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-21-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Clarence Wilson in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Clarence Wilson in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Clarence Wilson in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Clarence Wilson in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   Plea withheld as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
